result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wayne Donald Dronso Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wayne Donald Dronso Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Wayne Donald Dronso Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz has not received discovery and/or an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Wayne Donald Dronso Jr appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz would like time to review discovery and the offer and requests a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/2/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  Skyline Gas Mart.

Defendant Wayne Donald Dronso Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 01.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 2p
